Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: ruthm62
Reviews.Content: my partner, myself and two teenage boys stayed at the dixie hollywood for 3 nights from the 25th march 2012 and from check in to check out everything was fine. we arrived in the rain about 6pm,very friendly reception staff, i asked to see the room, not a prob, everything was clean, was given the room we were shown and parking was free. we were given extra coffee when we asked for it (my partner drinks far to much coffee), we slept very well and decided to go on a hollywood tour the next day, which the young lady at reception booked for us, the bus picked us up outside the dixie, we had a great day and was dropped back off outside the dixie, all for the same price as we would have paid if we had made our way to the tour office and booked it ourselves. matthew and the other lad at reception gave us advice on where to eat that eve when we asked and the next morning the young lady gave us advice on universal and printed off directions for us, as she also did the day we were leaving. we found the staff very friendly, polite and helpful and enjoyed our stay at the dixie. the only little thing was the breakfast which was only fruit, but renovations were going on at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dixie in April 2012 and was bitten by Bed Bugs, I was told the Manager would contact me, I also sent 2 follow up emails with no reply. I would not stay here as I was itchy for a few days. When I contacted reception they mentioned that they had another previous case,

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Chris802
Reviews.Content: Rooms were updated and clean, very nice but beds are very uncomfortable (wasnt a big deal for us). Location is good, not the best part of hollywood, but considering price and the fact that you are still close to everything you cant complain. For the price we paid I was very impressed, especially since parking was included. We didnt experience any of the parking issues others noted and they were fully booked during our stay. This hotel is mostly occupied by a younger crowd (not a surprise given location) so it can get noisy at night, was not an issue for me and my family but if you are a light sleeper this may not be the place for you. Overall we were very impressed and happy with our room. It is a motel, therefore if you are looking for the ammenities of a hotel you will not find it here.

Reviews.Title: “I would blame hotwire more then this motel”
Reviews.Author: ELITE32124
Reviews.Content: When a website like hotwire puts me there saying its a 3 star hotel, and it turns out to be a 1.5 star motel, we got a problem. If i went to this motel expecting a motel, i would just say I got what i paid for. Here is why its NOT a 3 star hotel and rather a 1.5 star or MAYBE 2 star motel. First, Dixie Hollywood Hotel was the DAYS INN....that should already ring alarm bells.......had I paid Motel price for this place, I probably wouldnt have posted a review, but this is to WARN hotwire customers that if you are getting sold a 3 star hotel in hollywood, you MIGHT get this place, which will truly disappoint you. Lets start with the location. This place is located on the east side of Hollywood, which will tell you its not the best part Hollywood has to offer. When you pull up in this motel, thats exactly what the surroundings are. It is NOT a hotel, if you go to "answers.com" here is what a motel is defined: Answer A motel, was derived as a combination of the words "motor hotel," is best described as a one or two story structure with rooms that open to the exterior of the building, usually surrounded by a common balcony or patio. A hotel has rooms that open to the interior of the building, along a hallway, and is multi-storied. Definitely not a HOTEL. Anyway, I check in and received the room next to their outdoor laundromat which with my luck, was laundry day since there were a couple of people using the facility. Since the walls and doors were paper thin, I can hear their conversations. Fortunately, I was leaving to my event, so I didnt have to hear why they took "Happy Days" off the air. But before I left, I went to my bathroom, to notice the moldy dirty sink that my 3 star MOTEL had for me. I had to brush my teeth in the shower because I didnt want any bacteria to grow on my tooth brush or tooth paste. When I arrived back at the MOTEL, all the parking spaces were full except for the registration spot. I parked there and notified the night clerk that I would be parking there. He decides its a perfect time to argue since its 3am. He told me that I cannot park there because it would be inconvenient for people who want to check in, but go ahead and park at the handicap spot. That made a lot of sense...lol, he doesnt want to inconvenience people who may want to check in, but go ahead and take up the handicap space of someone who may actually need the convenience to park there. I told him I did not feel comfortable taking up a handicap spot both morally and for the safety of my car (what if this clown leaves and forgets to tell the person taking over his shift that he allowed me to park there??). After 15 minutes of trying to convince me to park there and that it wont get towed or whatever, he decides to prove to me that its ok to park there by removing his car from one of the spaces that I could have parked in and to park there. I asked why didnt you do this in the first place?? he just ignored me and went back to his indoor MOTEL lobby. However, if it means anything, IF i KNEW what i was purchasing, I would have given it a 1.5 or 2 stars to be fair, but hotwire said i was getting a 3 star hotel and to me, thats false advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Fair value”
Reviews.Author: Callard1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a 3rd party vendor so our price was fair. In March 2012 there were under renovation. That was a bit of a pain, especially with parking but they are doing nice things. The rooms are clean but a bit drab. The neighborhood was fine but a little iffy after dark. We would return for a fair price but not if we could afford better. Please give me a "helpful" vote if this was helpful to you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Plus Parking”
Reviews.Author: Stan1701
Reviews.Content: That this hotel has an actual parking lot that gives you control of your car (as opposed to a valet lot) is a great plus. That it has nicely remodeled rooms is another plus. Our room was clean and comfortable, and it gave us a great headquarters for visiting Hollywood. If you don't want to deal with city parking, the Metro is very convenient. I recommend that you ask for a room on the upper floor. We were on the first floor and heard plenty of thumps from the people above us. Also, the rooms aren't huge, so if you're traveling with a group or packing along several kids, it might get a little crowded in a hurry. But for a couple or a small family, there's plenty of room. Note that the hotel is in the heart of Thai Town. If you like Thai food, you're in heaven. If you don't (like us), then don't plan on walking to a restaurant. But there's no shortage of food choices within a few minutes of driving or a Metro stop in any direction. All in all, for the price, the remodeled rooms and the parking, I felt it was a solid value in a town not known for values. You won't get the Ritz, but you won't pay Ritz prices, either.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: kw6289
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite small and set in a horseshoe shape with the car park in the middle (not as horrid as it sounds!) luckily we were on the bottom floor (only 2 floors) as I don't think there was a lift anywhere if you had lots of bags etc.. however this wouldn't really be a problem as you only go up one set of stairs to get to the second floor, and the reception staff are really friendly so I have no doubt they would help you with your things if needed. The hotel itself isn't in the best of locations, its address is 'Hollywood Boulevard' but in reality Hollywood Boulevard is sooo long it would be worth paying a bit more to make sure you had a closer hotel to the attractions (takes about 20 mins to walk to the walk of fame from here) It was also in quite a rough area, with not many restaurants nearby (apart from one nice diner pretty much next door) luckily we had a car but if you don't then it would be annoying for you if you wanted to just go out for dinner etc. The hotel room had enough space for the 4 of us, and was really clean and a housekeeping service was provided everyday. There is free wi-fi provided and free breakfast in the morning, the breakfast was the likes of toast, cereal, waffles etc, but in a small room which does get really busy. The staff were all friendly and quite helpful. There was a small pool area, which we didn't end up using, but we noticed it was clean and looked safe. We got this hotel for quite a reasonable price and if it was in a better location I would go back

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: Chrissycc
Reviews.Content: Nothing like the website suggests. A lot of construction work going on which we were not warned about. Told that we were being upgraded to a better room as we were on honeymoon but the room appeared worse than the room where we stored our bags initially. I assume they haven't renovated all the rooms yet. No wardrobe or anywhere to hang clothes. Due to renovation they do not have a breakfast room and only a cup of coffee and a danish were put on as a result. When we asked the staff about travelling around LA and getting to the airport only the most expensive options were mentioned (I believe they get a commission for car rental and airport bus / taxi) we had to find alternatives on the net. Wifi is very slow in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely an Excellent Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: wendysaxon
Reviews.Content: My room was great and I will definitely return. I usually stay in oricey downtown LA hotels a LOT so I have much to compare to the Dixie. First, my room was exactly as depicted in the first photo. It was welcoming, very comfortable and spacious, and very clean and comfortable. Staff is very friendly and the manager Israel is very commited to customers. Beds comfortable; bathroom had nice touches, modern accouterments. Neighborhool is fine during the day and pool looks very inviting. I am a psychologist staying there on business and no problems gettin work done and parking free and good restaurants nearby. IGNORE the less than 5 star reviews! If I had found any difficulties the manager would have immediately addressed them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: meganmckean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in mid January and were just needing somewhere relatively close to where we would be visiting. Although on Hollywood Boulevarde it is not ideally located - we had a hire car so this was not a huge problem. The neighbourhood doesn't feel very safe and we didn't do a lot of walking around the area in the night as a result. The rooms are large, clean and have all the necessary facilities, including a fridge and coffee maker. Although the rooms feel a little dated, they still do the job. The included continental breakfast was quite disappointing - plastic bowls and cutlery, dry break, orange fizzy drink in place of juice, and standing room only. It was fine for a bowl of cereal and to be on your way, but most definitely not a highlight or a reason to book this hotel. The staff were friendly and overall it was a fine stay, but nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: 29Kayleigh
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed in a double room, it was spacious enough and clean, but very noisey. The area wasnt great and eventhough its on Hollywood Boulevard dont be fooled. The area was quite dodgy and mainly thai/korean/chinese places. I would not walk around on the night. There are no restaurants or nice places to go to that are close by so driving is a must. However there is a diner next door that was quite busy in the morning and was very nice, we only went once due to it being too busy. The free breakfast was quite good, enough to keep you going but gets busy, the pool seemed nice but we didnt go in and the staff will book taxis for you if you need to. it is a 20 minute walk to the walk of fame, you go left out of your hotel and keep on walking, no signs to tell you this. If your wanting to stay in a cheap and clean hotel that is not close to many things then this is the one as its friendly and clean but I would recommend staying closer to the attractions or not in the centre at all. I would also recommend going on the movie stars homes and hollywood tour and also if your wanting to go out drinking around clubs go on the Hollywood club crawl tour which you can find on hostelworld.com its a bargain and the tour guides where amazing. very organised.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card statement for additional charges”
Reviews.Author: samuel L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel after booking through hotwire. When I arrived, the room was definitely not three star as advertised. I would probably give it a one and one half star. I should have complained to management but said nothing because I arrived late and just wanted to go to sleep. The room I was given didnt even resemble the pictures of their rooms online. I left the next morning and thought I was through with this place. Boy was I wrong! After I got my credit card statement, I noticed an extra $200 charge from this hotel. I called the hotel and spoke with the manager, Matthew. He informed me that I was billed for smoking in the room. I informed him that I dont smoke and never have in my 49 years of life. He was very insistant that someone smoked in my room because the housekeeper said there was an odor of smoke in the room. I told him that the room was definitely not one of the nicer rooms in his hotel and he agreed. I also told him to read reviews on other websites about smoke and other odors in their rooms. This manager said he would speak to housekeeping and and the local owners and get back to me about the charge. The next day, the manager insisted that I must have smoked in the room even though the only "evidence" they had was a statement of an "odor of smoke". I told him I DONT SMOKE AND I NEVER HAVE SMOKED AND I DIDNT SMOKE IN YOUR ROOM. He said that all he could do was reduce the charge to $100. I told him that was not acceptable and I would contact my creit card and dispute the charge. I have done so. If you get a room here BEWARE of them trying to charge you for smoking in the room even if you are a non-smoker like me.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sha A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dixie Hotel in Oct. The hotel was sooo cheap and we were on a budget. The hotel room is small but then again there were 4 women in one double bed room. The room was clean i must say! The beds were comfy and we had free wifi. Did not use the pool although it was clean. The parking space in front of our room was convenient also. There is a mini mall across the street and subway station nearby. i would stay again next time i visit LA if i cant afford anywhere else. was worth the little money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: We don't understand why this hotel would be rated 3 star(FYI it is NOT a hotel, more like an inn/motel).. When we agreed on purchasing a 3 star hotel from hotwire, the example of hotel given was Holiday Inn (well guess what, we stayed at holiday inn the day before-using another website-, if that was 3 star, there's NO way this dixie hollywood is a 3 Star. We've stayed at a 2 star hotel better than this. The room smelled stale, customer service was terrible and rude, shady place (at one point there a few police arresting a patron across the room from us). Overall, one of the worst hotel we've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Almost everything is in order”
Reviews.Author: fahmoh
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights, it is quite close to the Western Hollywood metro station (1 minute walk from the metro station lift), supermarkets on the other side of the street. You could connect to the whole city by the Metro if you don't drive. The receptionist were friendly and helped me find suitable tour packages. Everything was in order except the breakfast. You can have it between 7-9 AM but the serving area had only two available chairs. Others should either take it away or have it while standing behind a 2-meter table attached to the wall. The free wifi internet connection speed was ok to check email or simple browsing. The well-known walk of fame is just 10 minutes away by walking or take one metro station to Hollywood/vine. There are various tour agencies. museums (madam tussei wax, death, Guinness museums), kodak theater and clubs are around. There is also a burgerking and a McDonalds nearby. You could buy a sim-card from T-mobile across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Definantly worth staying!”
Reviews.Author: Kellydarlo
Reviews.Content: From my personal experience this is a great hotel especially if you are wanting to stay as a family! Very affordable especially considering the location. It is about a $10 cab ride to the main part of Hollywood. Straight across the road is a supermarket and the subway next door. The reception staff are very helpful and the maintenance man is really good. The hotel is really cool and like no other it has murals everywhere! It has a nice pool and also laundry facilities. The room itself was good for us as it had a fridge and a microwave and also a coffee maker. There is a good amount of free parking. They are still doing some refurbishments but it is looking really good. My only tip for anyone staying would be if you dont want to be disappointed get to breakfast early as it becomes very very busy in the mornings and there is not alot of room in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs.hell yeah!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Venuflare
Reviews.Content: Was there last week. It doesnt look good and clean like it was in the picture on net.i suggest to not come here specially if u have kids. Coz up to now i have 7 big bed bug bites on my 2 on my neck 3 on my left leg 1 on my right belly and 1 on my right arm.i noticed them when i woke up on my last stay there.and i was so pissed!!!! Their curtain looked like it had some blood droplets on it.and their blanket looks old and ugly. I am definitely not comming back there!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget motel”
Reviews.Author: sl91370
Reviews.Content: The hotel is being renovated - the parking is TIGHT. Overall, it is a good budget hotel if you want to save some money and don't mind a bare bones room. The beds were average, there was some sort of stain on the ceiling. The bathroom fan was hanging by its wires and luckily it wasn't hot during our stay as the AC barely kept the room reasonable. there was no door sweep on the bottom of our door so there was a large crack between the door and floor. We did not make any complaints and were ok staying here for the rate but just know this is not a five star hotel. Overall, it suited our needs but probably would stay somewhere closer to the walk of fame or sunset strip if we go again.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel near hollywood blvd”
Reviews.Author: Grolhy
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel the staff are really friendly and informative rooms are clean and very well presented with a tv fridge and showers , breakfast consists of cereal toast, waffles, coffee and juice the only complaint was the room where you get breakfast was way too crowed during the busy hours, the pool was clean it is right next to hollywood western metro station (only two stops from hollywood highland) and the griffith oberservertory/park and accoss the street a ralphs supermarket which is open till 2 am overall a really nice time thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good location and room. Only negative was bathroom roof collapsed.”
Reviews.Author: RobPitcherAUS
Reviews.Content: Room was really nice, and very convenient to red line transport. Had no trouble getting around by transport and walking. It is also within walking distance to just walk along Hollwyood Blvd to the 'main area' of Hollywood, following the name stars on the street as you go. Breakfast wasn't so great. Tiny little room and half the things were missing. They ran out of cups one morning, so we had to run back and get the ones from our room! Waffle maker looked like somebody had exploded a waffle mix bomb all over it. Didn't even want to touch it! I think the main downside was the roof collapsing above the shower while my mum was in it! Thankfully she was okay, and they gave a $30 discount (perhaps a little low considering what the cost of legal action would have been) on the room. Overall, I recommend this place for those with and without cars, but i would check other places before i return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mholtz25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on Hollywood Boulevard. It's across the street from a strip mall which includes a grocery store. Every hotel room has a microwave and fridge in it. However, the microwave has a mind of its own. It was very stubborn for us. The hotel is also about half a block away from a few bus stops which run quite frequently. Our room was conveniently located right across from the pool and next to the lobby. Israel, the front desk clerk, is very kind and even allowed us to check-in early. We didn't pay much for this hotel, but were pleasantly surprised at the value. There was granite countertops! Stay here! You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to be close to the action and tourist sites.”
Reviews.Author: bthurst7
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in May for her senior trip. We enjoyed staying at the hotel and it was clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful to us in many ways. The gentlemen at the front desk answered our questions if possible and when they were unsure they found out for us. They even called a cab for us to take us to the LA Zoo. Our rooms were cleaned in a timely manner and it was close to the Metro buses, therefore, it was easy for us to ride the buses to our destinations. The only thing that we didn't care for was the continental breakfast. The room was small and the selection was not very good. The only other thing that we didn't care for was there were quite a few loud people staying above and around us. Although this is really not under the hotel's control, it did seem that there were alot of young travelers that were a bit roudy, however, they did quiet down for the night. If you want a clean, comfortable hotel not far from the Hollywood Walk of Fame, then this is the place. But be ready to ride the bus because that is the easiest and cheapest way to get tothe middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Service let down”
Reviews.Author: harrykeates
Reviews.Content: We booked a room 4 MONTHS in advance, but when we arrived they told us they had no rooms avaliable and sent us away to a more expensive, grubby super 8

Reviews.Title: “mixup with Days Inn Hollywood hotels”
Reviews.Author: cricketnut29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Days Inn in Hollywood Blvde at the start of our four week holiday on the way to London to visit our son from Auckland. We are confident that we had booked the Days Inn Universal Studios hotel which was close to the Chinese Theatre and all details we had noted for our booking indicated this as the address and ph no were for this hotel as we booked direct. However when we arrived after having paid for the shuttle there we were told that they had no record of our booking and that we were booked in at the other Days Inn which is some way out of Hollywood and not even on the Walk of Fame which its name is attached to. As we had just come off a 12 hour flight from Auckland we were too tired to argue and then had to front up with a $25 taxi fare to get there from the Days Inn Universal Studios as the shuttle that had taken us from the airport had left. We booked Days Inn Hollywood/Universal Studios to be close to the centre of Hollywood and also Universal Studios which we went to for a day. No way had we booked the other Days Inn hotel however I will review Days Inn Walk of Fame seeing we ended up staying there. The hotel was O.K. in a pretty untidy area of L.A and not on the Walf of Fame as its name suggests although there was a supermarket and a Starbucks across the road and the area was quite safe to walk to and from Hollywood which was probably about 40mins and the weather was also not too hot. The room we had was located in the corner of the motel complex and right next to the laundry which caused us some grief the first night we were there as some inconsiderate guests decided to use it at 11.00pm at night despite there beign signs that it was supposed to be closed from 9.00pm on. This meant that we had no sleep as it was very noisy. We phoned reception but could get no reply so went and saw them the following morning to complain but they were disinterested so we left it at that but it did not leave a favourable impression of this hotel and its staff. However in their favour when we tried to use the laundry within hours and could not get it to work their maintenance man assisted us to get it operative and was very helpful. The road that the hotel is on is also very noisy with traffice and sirens going often so if you are looking for a quiet sleep forget this hotel. The rooms are old and dark inside but shower is fine and yopu have tea and coffee making faciitlities available although with Starbucks across the road and coffee and tea cheap you do not need this. We stayed three nights and enjoyed our time in L.A. but not this hotel. Also there is a complimentry buffett breakfast in the smallest breakfast room we have ever been in and what is offered is meagre comprsiing stale bread, horrible waffles and juice and we chose to go into Hollywoodd to get our breakfast.. On the basis of our stay we could not recommend this place particlularly as we felt like we had been tipped out to their other hotel perhaps becuase they were full and had overbooked people. Who knows.

Reviews.Title: “Only recommended if you a heavy sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Molly32655
Reviews.Content: Good location to Hollywood and sunset Blvd. lots of fast food eateries around and shops. A very low quality place to stay for the price. We had to move rooms due to terrible noise on our outside wall from the air conditioning units. Staff responded well to complaint however have not fixed noise. Request an upstairs pool facing room as we got moved to a ground level middle hotel room which is away from the original complaint however the noise from the above rooms terrible is with guests stomping round above us. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Need to be a heavy sleeper to survive here.

Reviews.Title: “Was an ok stay”
Reviews.Author: kayhun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for allstar weekend and the cleaning lady stole our leftover tequila.... I told the front desk abt it and all thy could do was have me email the manager who then offered me a discount on a room for one nights stay.....not very accomodating considering the fact that people that work for your hotel are stealing personal items from patrons [--]!! That's not coo other than thy the location was coo it was close to everythng in hollywood and shopping areas. I would stay only if it wass for one night and I am gonna stash my liquor!!

Reviews.Title: “Not very accommodating and lousy services”
Reviews.Author: ubericarus
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 12:30 PM from the airport with five pieces of luggage. The Asian woman at the front desk told us that rooms were not available until 2:00 PM and told us to come back at that time. I told her that we already had a reservation, and then she tried to scam me into paying $15.00 more to get a room before 2:00 PM. The parking lot was empty it did not seem like anyone I asked if they had a storage room for our luggage, and she told us to put it in the dining room. We place our luggage there and as we were walking out I told her will be back 2:00 PM. She mumbled something and smile very sarcastically. The Wi-Fi service never worked on any of my two laptops. There were ants in the bathroom and ceiling. The soda machine by the pool does have cold sodas. The area were this place is located has many other motels and hotels. I suggest that you look elsewhere because for a $120.00 a night and the bad service. It is simply not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “simply terrible”
Reviews.Author: gabriel_palmeiras
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience. First we have booked two rooms, 3 weeks in advance, but then they said there was no room available, and we should sleep all together on the same one room. On the next day, without any notice, it took place LA marathon, and we couldn't leave the hotel for the whole morning. We got really mad because it was our last day in LA and we couldn't do nothing apart from staying in the room watching TV. Besides, they claim to be a walk distance from walk of fame... Lie!! it is 45min fast walk distance!! I do not recommend this hotel even for my worse enemy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: mrs_frisbee
Reviews.Content: Whilst on Hollywood Blvd, it's not near the walk of fame or Chinese theater, although it's super-convenient for the Metro station at Hollywood and Western. Room was fine, better than expected for the price. Bathroom a little tired looking, but spotless. Really friendly and thorough cleaning staff. Receptionist was grumpy and unhelpful. Can get noisy, mainly other guests, but nothing really bad. Probably wouldn't stay there again because the location wasn't convenient, but for the price I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - this is all you need”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is great. When in LA, a rental car is a neccessity to get around. This place has plenty of safe parking, right on Hollywood Blvd. It's about 15min walk to Grumans theatre, 10min drive to Universal. The rooms are spacious, cleaned daily, and the breakfast is basic but fine. This is a great place to base yourself in LA and save a bucket of money.

Reviews.Title: “very average - no value for money”
Reviews.Author: raghu80
Reviews.Content: I did stay at this hotel during thanks giving .. not impressive. front desk ppl have contacts with rental car services where you get average car for rent for more money. Also per policy this hotel dont refund money even if you cancel reservation well in advance and you get rude response when you call for cancel reservation. Try to stay away from this hotel. Location is good by the way.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: islandlady96706
Reviews.Content: Thanks to my sister that booked our stay here. We got to check in early. Room was more then what we expected. Breakfast was better then other places with lots of variety to choose from. Stayed there in November and it was pretty cold, thought it wasn't such a good idea to take a dip in the pool but to our surprise it was a heated pool which was also a plus for us because our kids love to swim. Parking was a gated parking, needed your room key to get in. We really had a good experience here.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: tigers-ol
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here in early october as a base to explore LA. Pros: About 1,5 mile off walk of fame Nice paint job on the walls. Free parking Comfy beds Cons: Pool is nice but not heated. (Freeeezin) nobody used it in the 4 nights we stayed. Breakfast is toast and 2 types of cerial. Brekfast room seats 10 people so expect to stay in line, even if you only want to grab some stuff to bring to your room. Wifi ranged from very slow to not working. Wear shoes in the rooms, they are noe vaccum cleaned, only swept with a broom. Overall you get what you pay for, and remember Hollywood is a tough neighborhood Not much else to see or do other than the stuff arround walk of fame. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great,cheap and excellent location in...”
Reviews.Author: sdp84
Reviews.Content: Great,cheap and excellent location in Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LondonEnglandHelen
Reviews.Content: We had booked here as it was less than $100 a night. However, after 3 nights in a hostel right by Graumanns Chinese Theatre, we were horrified as it seemed a long way down Hollywood Blvd, away from everything. Our panic was short lived. It is right next to Hollywood Western Metro station and there were buses outside to get to attractions in minutes. There was a conveneint Ralphs market aross the road and a Ross Dress 4 less. The room was clean and tidy and a nice but small pool are and the laundry room was very good value, a wash and dry for $1.50. The staff were not overly helpful, they gave us bad information on getting to Anaheim and didn't ahve the best customer service skills, And breakfsat was pointless as room was overcrowded and impossible to get a slice of toast. However for a young traveller who is using public transport, then this is ideal. However for about $40-$50 a night more Days Inn on Sunset is a much better option as is literally mins from Graummans, and a bus ride from Sunset Strip etc

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay. Great price!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Buggman
Reviews.Content: I have seen so many negative views but this place was clean friendly and quiet. Will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Richard555
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very adequate and located close to a Metro station and buses. The staff were friendly and most helpful. The room provided everything we needed including microwave and fridge. The breakfast room did get crowded sometimes, but it was easy to take food back to the bedroom, no problem. It was much quieter than I expected and I would definitely stay there again. The only problems we had were tiny ants in the bathroom and the keycard had to be reset almost every day after the room was cleaned - both very minor details - no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Close to attractions, clean & comfortable !”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2d
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on the hotel website directly for around 73$ a night. This was a 2 queen bed AC room. The room was big and clean. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom though a lil worn out, was clean. There was a mini fridge, coffee maker and microwave in the room. There was a tv in the room (though not flat TV). The rooms were cleaned and beds made everyday when we were there :) There was a lil traffic noise as our room was close to the main street but we were too tired and didnt have trouble sleeping. We had free parking for our car and free wireless internet. Also there was free breakfast in the morning in a small room behind the reception. There were hot waffles, juice, coffee, toast and milk n cereal. Breakfast times were super crowded though. The swimming pool was closed for cleaning when we were there. The hotel is close to attractions like Chinese theatre, Kodak theatre, walk of fame etc. but it isn't walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “I was scared after I booked and read reviews, pleasantly surprised!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iluvtotravel23
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked this motel online trying to save $. After I read the reviews we were scared of what we would get. For the money it was just fine. Good parking, easy access. Everthing we needed for the nights. Nice pool, although we didn't use it. So glad we booked a rental car to get places. Sure, its not a fancy place with a big breakfast but for the $ it was JUST FINE!!!!!!!!!!! We felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nick1970
Reviews.Content: Booked the motel for a week, check in and out was good, staff were friendly. location was good, room was clean. close to public transport. There is a diner next to the motel which was great for breakfast and a supermarket across the road.Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice about this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Journeyman1074
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write reviews and when I read others, I try to keep an open mind. I've stayed here the past few years from time to time. Price was ok, rooms clean but basic. Never saw any bugs. However, my last trip put me off this place for good! I was placed next to room that was undergoing construction and also had very noisy neighbors (adults talking loud every morning). Late Sat night (11PM) they came back to the room drunk and with a group of friends. Extremely noisy. Called down twice to front desk, they didn't bother the first time, then they came and told everyone to be quiet. Didn't help. Another guest on the other side of that room also called the front desk. Noise continued, they were extremely drunk. I serioously thought of calling the cops. Finally around 3AM they started to get unusually quiet. That's when I started to smell something strange coming from the common door between the rooms, marijuana! As much as I wanted to call the front desk or even the cops, I didn't want any trouble for myself so I put pillows at the bottom of that door, covered my face and tried to sleep. Finally went to sleep around 4:30AM, I was supposed to be up at 6AM! Around 8AM, a friend of the noisy neighbors came to their room and started banging on their door and calling them, when they didn't answer, he went to housekeeping who then decided it may be the wrong room and opened mine instead! No knock on my door, just someone opening it with a key without my consent! Luckily I had the deadbolt on it. When I checked out, the lady at the front counter apologized for the night (she wasn't the night person on duty) and gave me a discount on the room. It really should've been free but I was to tired to fight the issue. I left promising myself I would never return! Location is great if you want to be in Hollywood, close to Graumann's, etc. However, the area is really bad now. There's always people hanging around very late at night. They had a security guard out in the parking lot on Friday night; they should also have one on Saturdays. Days Inn recently airbrushed a movie star motiff over all the rooms and exterior walls which really makes it look even cheaper and seedier. Mgmt doesn't do anything about the problems in their place. Do yourself a favor, find something better!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: sanjuansky
Reviews.Content: The good: Location, parking, nice and clean room with good bed, microwave and mini fridge, there's a Russ and a supermarket across the street, internet in lobby, original exterior decor with palm trees and a pool. A great value. The bad: Old building and it shows, some rooms are located in obscure corners, some street noise, its breakfast salon is a joke with no space for more than 10 people and with minimal or no service form staff. A jewel in the rough. All in all a great place for travelers on a budget that are just looking for a nice room to sleep in and to be near all the mayor atractions. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but...”
Reviews.Author: DavidG80
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is convenient especially if you intend to visit Hollywood and Downtown Los Angeles using public transportation, as the Metro rail station going either way is literally next door. However, this was outweighed by having to deal with the smelly and noisy room (our neighbors kept us awake each and every night simply by talking among themselves and using faucets) and the surly and unhelpful staff (with one single exception), turning our four day stay here into the least pleasant after years of traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, dirty, not cheap at all for the staying!!”
Reviews.Author: didocad
Reviews.Content: On Saturday, we were looking for a nice place to stay after visiting the Griffith Observatory, and we found this days inn hotel in Hollywood. The bathroom was dirty, hair and dust in the corners, the water from the shower was only warm at his maximum, then on Sunday, we were awake early by a background effect using applause and screams probably recorded at the Oscar venue, that the hotel was using on and on for its Hollywood effect... that was really bad, awful!! And everything was for $. 171.00 which I thing was very expensive for what we got and what we did not get!

Reviews.Title: “Safe , suitable and good price”
Reviews.Author: sdeniz
Reviews.Content: $ 15 per person one night closer to everywhere suitable for 3 people

Reviews.Title: “lots of noise at night, good location”
Reviews.Author: kelfunk
Reviews.Content: Some of the staff was very nice and pleasant, one person was not. Bathroom smelled really bad. Was located on the first floor, heard everything that went on upstairs and in the next door rooms. Heard all the noise from outside during the night. Location is great. Room was cold at night.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: gregexpedia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for five nights, this hotel is located directly on hollywood blvd, so it is great location. I would recommend renting a car in L.A., however the hotel is steps away from the metro. This hotel is directly across the street from a mall, which has starbucks, quiznos, and a grocery store(that sells liquor!) I had a great stay in this hotel with no problems. If you are going on vacation to stay in your room, don't stay at this hotel because not all the t.v. channels work, and it is not a 5 star hotel, however if you are doing the tourism thing and seeing the L.A. sites this hotel is GREAT! It is a great place to lay your head after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “I think it was the hookers that put me off.”
Reviews.Author: Marko56
Reviews.Content: Noisy air conditioner and very basic breakfast. On the upside, the hotel is very handy to metro and there is a big supermarket across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but dont expect too much...”
Reviews.Author: AussieDave_2309
Reviews.Content: All I have to say about this hotel is the staff are very friendly and the pool area is not bad. Its not a bad location being on Sunset Blvd, but not what I expected. Rooms are average to say the least. Very musty and not exactly clean. The staff are great and made me feel good about the stay but unfortunately its not a great place to stay. Stay in Beverly Hills or Santa Monica if you are going to LA....

Reviews.Title: “Didnt get to stay but Ended up paying anyways”
Reviews.Author: s0gorgeous
Reviews.Content: What a crappy service. I made a reservation for June 7th 2009 and had to cancel. I called at the end of May to cancel. I called 2 days later to make sure it was canceled because I never got a confirmation number or email. I was assured it was canceled by the second person I talked to and he also told me that there is not an email that goes out and my confirmation number is the same as my reservation number. I then called one more time 3 days before my reservation date just to be sure because I did not want to be charged for the room I was told again, it showed canceled. To my surprise I checked my Credit Card and there is a charge. I called today and I was told that it was a No show charge. Somehow the manager is never in, doesnt have a schedule and can only be reached by email. (and by reached I mean I send an email and get nothing back.) Dont bother, the location may be its only perk.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely regret coming back for a second stay”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Grace81
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. And when I say location, I mean it's proxemity to the center across the street (Ralph's, Starbucks and so on) and the view of the Hollywood Hills. But everything else was a disaster. We'd stayed there once before in 2007 but it didn't seem quite as bad the first time. We arrived late and were given the handicapped room. Upon entering, we experienced a foul smell and as we walked across the floor, there seemed to be a huge hole under the carpet infront of the bed. Then we were given a room on the back wall on the second floor. With 6 suitcases, it wasn't easy to load/unload the car. We instantly took the blanket off, curled it up and put it in the "closet" for the entire duration of the stay. The reason... well how often are they cleaned really and the fact that there were huge stains on it. Yuk. The curtains seemed to have a matching stain pattern. The carpet was nasty and we spent our time in the hotel with either flip flops or socks... sock which basically were garbage upon departure. Breakfast was terrible... something that resembled vending machine bearclaws and plain toast. And as far as I can recall coffee was only available for an hour. The housekeeping staff didn't understand much english and the frontdesk staff were rude. The TV was terrible and only a few channels were watchable, though not totally clear. And the fixtures and counter in the bathroom looked like there were going to fall off the wall at any given time. The walls were paper thin and we could frequently hear our "neighbors" enjoying a little extra cirricular actviity. We experienced that on several nights there were guys hanging out in cars in the parking lot and found empty liquor bottles in the morning. Honestly sometimes the money that you save staying at a place like this is NOT worth the time and headache that follows. This place could be a gem and would gladly pay $25 extra per night if everything was perfect because the location is pretty great (if you have a car that is).

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Friendly Staff and Horrible Cleaning service”
Reviews.Author: atoni5
Reviews.Content: We wanted to come and check in early and the hotel clerk was kind of rude. Instead of being nice about it and checking he was just adamant that there were no rooms ready yet. The continental breakfast was a joke. It was two choices of cereal and some toast & coffee. That is it!!! When we left and came back from out day at Universal our bed was not made just because we forgot a piece of luggage on the bed. They did not throw away any of the garbage and my son got bug bites on his neck and arms. There was a cigarette burn on the blanket. They charged us a lot for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “unusual payment request”
Reviews.Author: smacdon33
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel via Wyndham Rewards thinking they had the same policies as Ramada,,wrong !!!. when we arrived we were told the ony rooms were at the back of the 2nd storey,we had 4 suitcases to carry and no assistance was available. my credit card was rung up for the full 3 day stay before we saw the rooms,ie payment in advance bearing in mind they already had our credit card details via the booking. when i queried this request l was informed that it is standard in the USA.and that the card would not be charged but they demanded I sign the credit card authority for the full amount at booking in.agaon I refused to pay in advance but allowed to to scan the card for reference as is normal thru-out all hotels we have stayed in in Europe,Asia and numerous times int he USA.The folowing day after being out we were locked out of our room as the manager had decided to demand payment once again, why not just knock or leave a message on the door.Once again i was informed that it is policy for all hotels to swipe the credit card for the full amount upon arrival but amazingly they tried to tell me that this was not authority for payment, how stupid do they think we are ???.we compromised by me paying for each night in advance. ps breakfast is nothing like Ramada,crap coffee and sugar do-nuts,we ate at a local diner.. the place is clean and safe plus a good locale, I would stay but plan your food and stay your ground on payment.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and cheap. Okay.”
Reviews.Author: cjsluk
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this hotel does not offer 5* luxury, but it is not 5* prices. Our stay at the hotel was overall very good. Our room was basic but very clean and included a TV and a fridge. Parking was on-site and was free, the pool area is very nice for those hot afternoons and the pool was of a good quality. There was some upgrade work going on during our stay and we could see that most rooms were getting new carpet and paint. The outside of the hotel was being painted with Hollywood murals which looked very cool and defiantly added to the image of the hotel. The location was very good for the Metro which was located around 150 meters from Hollywood/Western station which is on the red line. Chinese theatre was around a 10 minute drive in typical traffic and around 20 minutes to the Beverly Hills area. I would say the local facilities are okay, it is just across the road from a Starbucks and there is a small shopping centre across from the hotel with a handful of uninteresting stores. There are a number of places to eat in the local area but they were not to my taste, mainly small restaurants and for some reason almost all Thai. I preferred taking the car and going further a field to eat. Overall this hotel was basic, but it was clean and suitable and within easy driving distance of all LA has to offer. We booked online and the price we received was very good.

Reviews.Title: “It depends on which room you get.”
Reviews.Author: RalphES
Reviews.Content: I am a paraplegic and we booked online. When we arrived we were given an older room that the carpet hadn't been changed since the 70's, tiny washroom and the smell was awful. We went to the front desk and told them the problem we had with the washroom and they then changed our room to one that was recently renovated, for $40 per night you can't beat it if you get one of the good rooms with the larger washroom. Great location with a grocery store across the street and subway only a 100 feet away. Central to lots of Hollywood attractions, if you are going there try and get tickets for The Late, Late Show with Craig Ferguson. This was the best part of our trip, get tickets ahead of time and be ready to laugh yourself silly.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and ok”
Reviews.Author: artyadd
Reviews.Content: cheap and did the job, good location for things like walk of stars, universal studios etc

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, dirty carpet, stinky room, sheets with blood stains.”
Reviews.Author: marry61
Reviews.Content: Disgusting, dirty carpet, stinky room, sheets with blood stains. Literally disgusted. Save yourself! came from Florida, my husband and I stayed there one night. Never ever will go back there. Not recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “good place. great location”
Reviews.Author: markmyname
Reviews.Content: the location is great. right in the middle of hollywood bvd. 2 min walk from the famous (and very disappointing) "star strip" and 10 min walk from the chinise theatre. the rooms are very spacious, and you have a little refrigiratore and a little micro oven. bathroom is very nice, big and has everything neccesesary. the internet is a little slow. a very nice hotel, with a very good location. has parking !!!! very important.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing really to say”
Reviews.Author: lottiandjohn
Reviews.Content: Location was good, same street as manns chinese theatre and other hollywood attractions. Room was ok, no problems there but noises were non stop all night, the walls were paper thin and I didn't get any sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service and smelly room”
Reviews.Author: stwauk
Reviews.Content: Everyone should know what to expect when booking a ‘Days Inn’ hotel. We were under no illusions of what to expect upon arrival and we were only staying for 3 nights as a stop over from Hawaii and then onto London. What we didn’t expect though was to be told upon arrival that our reservation had been cancelled earlier in the day due to my credit card not being approved that day. This was at 11:45 at night after a very long day in the air. It would appear that even though I had entered my details back in May through booking on their website and receiving a confirmation, the hotel themselves only check the validity that day. For some reason my card was not accepted on the day and because my mobile was a European number they have a policy of not contacting you outside of the U.S. So we were never going to find this out until our arrival. Not happy! We had to find another hotel which was not an easy feat at 12:00 midnight on a Saturday night. Breakfast was complimentary but not very nice. Suggest use of IHOP across the road which is open 24hrs. We decided to try the hotel for the following 2 nights (the card worked fine!). The room was relatively clean but had an awful smell of what can only be described as cat’s urine. Overall I was very disappointed with the hotel to the extent that we will probably not use Days Inn chain again (in any country).

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: loves-to-travel76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn Hollywood for three nights in February. The hotel standard is about what you would expect from an american chain motel. The room was fairly clean and it had all necessary facilities. The bed was large and comfortable. Even though LA typically is not a city where you can walk from place to place, we found this location to be quite good. We walked to the major Hollywood sites (Kodak theatre etc) and even though it took us somewhere betwwen 30-60 min, it was a nice walk. The brakfast was not much to talk about, but there is a little brakfast place right next to the hotel and the food here was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clive165
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 years ago and before writing this review thought id take a look at current reviews to see if it has improved and obviously it has not! We stayed here for our second time in Hollywood and what a mistake.The hotel actually looks quite good looking at its website and i also thought booking a days inn hotel would be ok,alas it was not! The hotel is filthy,not just dirty but filthy.There were cigarette burns on the sheets and on the carpet.The whole place smelt musky and i came away with a couple of bites! Worst of all the door to our room looked as if at some time or another there had been an attempt to force it open,now thats really off putting! We did have bfast which was sufficient, for me and my wife but my daughters had had enough by then and rather than chance it decided to stay in the room!There is a swimming pool which on the web site looks quite large.However the pool is actually very small and just a dumping ground for litter.The hotel is situated some way along from the main points of interest on Hollywood boulevard and is in an area whch starts becoming a little sleazy.There was only one plus about staying at the days inn and that there was a good starbucks opposite! Never ever stay here,you have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Underated: Ignore the Awful Reviews”
Reviews.Author: jgb10011
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel does not quite deserve a four rating here (really more like a 3.25), but I am overcompensating for the bad reviews I read beforehand. I needed a place for three nights to sleep and do some work in the evenings for three nights. My criteria were simple: clean, comfortable. economical, and in a convenient location (as my meetings were all around the L.A. area). This Day's Inn hit the mark on all fronts (though the maid service could have been better). Reading all the recent reviews I had serious second thoughts about this hotel, so only booked for one night and had a back-up booked for the next two nights. With regard to the bad review comments: I did find one cockroach in the bathroom when I arrived, but the little critter was quite dead (so the exterminator had done his work), and saw none dead or alive since. (It's an old building in the middle of the city, so an occasional roach should not be a shock to any experienced traveler, especially if it's already dead). The first room I was given was a bit shabby (the rugs were older and stained here and there and the bed covers a bit threadbare in spots) and the rugs could have been cleaner (like the maid never bothered to vacuum close to the walls or corners), but the bathroom was spotless and overall cleanliness satisfactory. As I could not connect to the Internet from that room, I asked to be moved to a room closer to the office, and much to my surprise this room was two stars higher in quality: new bathroom with granite sink and contemporary shower curtain, upscale (almost former Marriott quality) bedding with sophisticated matching window treatments (not just curtains). Rest of room was pretty standard. My only criticism would be that management must have low standards as even though much of the room was newly remodeled, no one ever bothered to do the finishing touch cleanup (i.e., cleaning up the excess caulking around the granite or the paint smudges off the shower fixtures, and again, getting the maids to vacuum thoroughly). The location for foreign tourists (who tend not to rent cars) is convenient to bus service and less than a half block to the metro entrance. For motorists the entrance to the Hlywd Freeway (101) is also a half block away and though no business or tourist sites are walking distance, you can't beat the location (less than 20 minutes to Burbank and the TV and movie studios there, Universal Studios, downtown L.A., Hollywood tourist sites, etc. More convenient yet is that you are in the middle of "Thai Town", a restaurant destination for locals, with dozens of authentic Thai eating establishments in every price range and that serve late even on week nights. Also nearby is a Quiznos, Cold Stone Creamery, large Ralph's supermarket and more, so you never need to travel if you're hungry. In conclusion, NO, this is not up to the standards of a newer suburban or Interstate highway exit Day's Inn, and it's nowhere close to a Marriott Courtyard or even a Hampton Inn, but it is also half the price, and at $65-$80 on average for a room, quite a value compared to most anything else around

Reviews.Title: “If you can't do a decent continental breakfast...don't do one at all”
Reviews.Author: RizzoDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: I can not understand hotels that promise a continental breakfast and produce a pathetic display. Hotels/motels try to compete with other better motels, and I swear if the stuff isn't better in a vending machine. First, the staff doesn't even bring anything out til after 7:00 a.m. All I wanted was coffee, and they gave this horrible sweet role that looked like it was a vending machine reject. No coffee! Warm milk, cruddy roll, crappy plastic utensils. So, hotel management, if you can't do it decent, don't do it at all. Fortunately, there was a little cafe right at the base of this building that was acceptable. Aside from the ugly building, the room is just barely adequate. The TV channels were a mess. Maybe 3 or 4 were clear.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: boomica
Reviews.Content: If you like sleeping with roaches, then please by all means book a room soon. These critters were everywhere in our room. I stayed there for a 2 night stay with my sister and a cousin but little did we know we'd have little visitors spending the night with us. I mean the roaches were coming out of a hole in the wall in the bathroom. Then noticed them on the walls. We decided to tell the front desk who seemed not to care what-so-ever and couldn't even give us another room because they were sold out for the evening. They weren't even apologetic and looked at us as if we were over reacting. It was a horrible experience. Not only was our vacation ruined, but we had to go home and empty out our suitcases in the garage to make sure none of those roached decided to hitch a ride in our luggages and invade our homes. Thanks to this hotel I will never think twice about saving a few extra bucks when it comes to accomodations. Thanks Days Inn, if there was anything good you've could've given me, it would be to stop being so cheap. (Be on the lookout for my cousins review, hers should include the pics)

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: tshirtsuntan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September and had mixed feelings about the place. When we checked in the receptionist (possibly management) was very friendly and helpful, giving us tips on the area and sorting a room for us although it was 2 hours before check in. The room itself was nice enough, the bathroom was clean and the bed comfy and the fridge and microwave a nice touch. It had an excellent location, only 2 mins from the Hollywood/Western Metro station and bus stops, with a supermarket and food places across the street. The downsides of the property were the noise from the road, the noisy people next door who were shouting on the terrace outside til at least 2am and the thin walls. Also the rate for the Tuesday and Wednesday nights was ok at $100, but to stay the Thursday was $140 which we thought was pretty steep given the quality of the hotel. Also the free breakfast was horrendous, white toast, jam and pre-packaged cakes, don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Bates Motel -- AVOID.”
Reviews.Author: kendra105
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel unless the rate is under $30. We paid a $109 for this hotel but the cost should have been around $30. The A/C unit produced a strange odor but it was too hot to not have it on. The location is really sketchy and I wouldn’t really walk outside late at night. Also very loud from traffic, hard to sleep. The staff is extremely rude and didn’t provide any help when needed. They say they have a continental breakfast but be prepared to have stale cereal which you can only have before 9 in the morning. This motel was dirty and the neighborhood is defiantly one you don’t want to be in after dark. Many people lurking on the side walk and all you can smell is urine. Random floating things in the pool, defiantly not swimable. The location is close to Universal and Hollywood Blvd. granted but it’s defiantly not worth it. It would be better to drive a couple minutes more and at least have a decent rate for a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location thats it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: littlechef7
Reviews.Content: This days inn is in need of a total refit and overhaul,the rooms were on the dark side,air-con was not working prpoperly in room 233,the rooms were needing to be brightened up and also the walkways and corridors to and from the rooms to the car park,receptionand to hollywood bld itself.If all this was done it would be a goldmine for the owners as just 100yards to the left as you exit is the metro hollywood/western,this was very handy save yourself a drive and see the sights with no hassle 5dollars for aday ticket great value,breakfast is adequate but not alot of choice if you dont like toast or danish pastries your stuffed

Reviews.Title: “Not Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: roderules
Reviews.Content: Be advised, if you are lookin for something special this ain't it. It's basically a low average motel. The furniture is beat, the linens are hole ridden and please for god's sake, don't wonder too much about just what those weird spots are on the blanket. Just pull up the spread and try to forget about it. I like a lot of light in my room and all of the lamps were totally inadequate and burned those low wattage sprial bulbs. Barely enough light to see let alone ready by. They offered free internet access, but you needed to bring your computer as close to the window as possible to get a signal. There also isn't a spare electrical outlet anywhere in the room. Good size bathroom. AC was horrible. It would run a bit, get cool then shut off before the room got comfortable. It is near the Metro stop and very close drive to Hollywood tourist stuff like the Chinese theatre. Here's a bit of trivia; the coffee shop next door is frequented daily by the woman who was Vampira during the '50 and was in Plan 9 from Outer Space. She lives in the Elderly Housing next door. IT's true, I had coffee with her. That's still not enough to seriously recommend this motel. There are lots of better places to stay and at least as cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Metro line”
Reviews.Author: dehnehsu
Reviews.Content: I paid $67 a night (internet rate) for a Sunday, Monday stay in May before the Memorial Day weekend. Our room and the Hotel was very clean. Staff friendly. No complaints. They have a decent amount of parking spaces and there were always a few left at night. Across the street is a 24 hr Ralphs grocery store, Ross Dress For less, Quiznos Sandwiches. The area seemed pretty safe even after hours. I chose this Hotel because of the location away from the congestion of the busier part of Hollywood Blvd. The location east of the freeway (101) and right next door to the Metro Red line was ideal. For $3 per person you could ride Metro rail and the buses all day. The hotel is near the Hollywood/Western stop. From there the next stop is Hollywood/Vine, then Hollywood/Highland the popular tourist stop with the Kodak Theater, and Graumans Chinese Theater. It's nice not having to seek out and pay for parking at the Highland complex and getting a ticket validated for a discount. The subway is clean and safe especially during regular hours. One more stop is Universal Studios where you can cross the street and take a free Tram roundtrip up to City Walk or the Studios saving $10 parking. It can be tough to make a left turn out of the Days Inn property onto sometimes busy Hollywood Blvd. I played it safe and made right turns to get back to Western and Hollywood Blvd. and then used the lights to make a left turn.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than an average to poor motel.”
Reviews.Author: AmyPC
Reviews.Content: This really was not great. We checked in, were initially given a room on the ground floor, it was somewhat run down but bearable. However, the window would not lock and opened directly onto a carpark on the outside of the property. After initially being offered a piece of wood by the guy at reception, to secure the window to prevent it being opened from the outside (no, I'm not kidding), we were then told a piece of wood could not be found for this purpose (thankfully!) and we were moved to another room, which was somewhat better than the first. However, it was not great by any means. The carpet was icky and stained. The bedding was ok. The room was blah. It had a fridge and microwave, which was handy for us. Soundproofing was bad. We could hear every siren going past clear as a bell, people talking loudly, yelling etc. out in the carpark. To their credit, the daily maid service was fine. There's internet at reception, for a fee. It was good to have a supermarket across the road, we were very pleased with that. We drove to the sights, they were not walkable (we knew that though). The pool area would probably be ok in warmer weather but by no means should it make you choose this place over anywhere else. I must say, the price was right though - $59 a night or something like that. If you're really not fussed about where you stay, I guess this is ok, otherwise, search a bit more and you'll most likely find something nicer for not too much more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MelbAus2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel in March 2007 when I visited LA from Australia. I booked this motel based on the good reviews I saw on this site however now I found them to be misleading. I just want to provide a different point of view here. I am not a critical person. In fact this would be the first negative review I have written. I travelled often and I can easily say this is one of the worse places I have stayed at. I have very basic standards, as I only sleep in a motel a few hours at night anyway. Unfortunately Days Inn Hollywood failed to meet my most basic standards at every count. Top 10 problems 1.Interior - This motel was supposed to be newly renovated but everything from carpet to furniture to wall was old (see pic). I had a very hard time imagining what it was like before the “renovation”. However this wasn’t a big problem as I was not there to admire its interior design. 2.Internet - Wireless internet was important to me but it did not work on the first night but it did work at other times. 3.TV - The remote control for the TV did not work. 4.Service - One of the lamps in the room did not work either. But that was only the beginning… When I found out that it didn’t work I went down to reception and asked (very politely) whether they had a spare light bulb. I didn’t really expect them to have any but I thought it was worth a try as the room was very dark. However the response I got from the front desk staff shocked me. He rolled his eyes, raised his voice and said: “is it really THAT important to have a light bulb changed at this hour at night??” (It was 930pm.) I was very shocked at his response as I asked very politely! I am no expert but I thought a simple “sorry I don’t have any spare bulbs but I will let housekeeping know tomorrow” may have been a much better response. That was the worst service I have received at a motel. 5.Bedding - There were holes in every layer of bedding from the sheets, blanket, to bed cover (see pic). Well at least they were consistent! The pillows were so old and worn out I would have thrown them out years ago. 6.Interior - There was a hole in the wall and they put a tissue box in it (see pic). I have to give them points for innovation. 7.Noise - Some of the rooms can be very noisy as it is on Hollywood Blvd., a 6-lane street. 8.Location - The location is not very central. It’s at the edge of Hollywood and most locals actually consider that part of town as “Thai town” rather than Hollywood. 9.Diner - The diner closes at 6pm and honestly if it stays open longer I still would not eat there. It didn’t look right. Sometimes when I walked by and saw only 1 staff person as the chef/waiter/cleaner. 10.Smell – This was the problem that affected me the most. On the first day I was given a supposedly non-smoking room however the room totally stink. I was hoping it was cigarette smell but it could be something worse! I didn’t know what the smell was. I went to reception but they insisted it was a non-smoking room. I put up with the smell on the first night but I was coughing and was frustrated. I had my windows opened (with a busy 6-lane street only meters away) but the smell persisted. I was kept up by the traffic noise and/or smell, and only slept for 2 hours. I went back to the reception next day and made up some lame excuse to get a different room (as they insisted the room is fine the day before). The second room didn’t smell and I felt much better then. The only merits I found of this motel is that it is located within 50 meters of a metro station, bus station and supermarket. And housekeeping did a good job cleaning the room. As you can see I had a terrible experience and I would not recommend it to anyone other perhaps students. When I was there there was a group of 30-40 high school students stayed there and they seemed to have a good time on their school trip. Some people may still find this place okay, but please don’t expect anything more than a one star motel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: sherknd
Reviews.Content: This was my worst hotel experience ever. I was surprised since it was a Days Inn, and the reviews on this website are mostly good. Dirty sheets and blankets, TV had 4 working channels, HBO was fuzzy (funny since outside the window in the trashy area below was the sattelite dish). We were supposed to get nonsmoking but we got smoking. Cockroaches.. It was terrible and we will let everyone know.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Newly Renovated Rooms - VERY TRENDY and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: soul7
Reviews.Content: This has to be THE best economy hotel in Hollywood. The location is excellent. Right next to the metro which took my family and I everywhere including Universal, and the major Hollywood attraction with a pass that is only $3 a day. The rooms are soooo trendy, and clean. They are all brand new with colors, and good energy. The pool is very big, and has music to provide to a resort like hotel. The staff is so friendly, and everyone is always smiling, and willing to help in any way or form. I've recommended this hotel to all the travel agents in my town, and many people have booked, stayed, and very much enjoyed their say. They have a famous diner on their hotel property that serves delicious breakfast. I've come back to Days Inn Hollywood Blvd. 4 times already, and will continue to use them. Thnk you so much for defining excellent service in the economy sector of Hollywood hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: Wensi
Reviews.Content: I've based here for my 6 days LA trip. I've booked the room thru daysinn.com 2 week in advance and was given quite a good rate. This motel is situated along Hollywood Blvd, a junction after Western Ave. There's a subway (Metro) beside it (4 minutes walk), Ralphs Supermart opposite (3 minutes walk) and a few eateries along side. If you're a Thai food fan, just cross the street, walk to your right for about 5 minutes, there's a Thai Food Restaurant (a simple-decorated cafe) which serves economical authentic stuff. Most of their customers are Thai. I've tried their beef noodle clear soup, seafood fried rice and Pad Thai and all are yummy! Noodles are charge at $3 (small) and $5 (large), fried rice is $6 and Pad thai is $5.50. The internet access from room is free. Just bring along notebook and get the password from the counter staff (wireless access). Internet speed is ok, but if your room is far away from main office, line gets drop off easily. Breakfast is very simple, coffee/tea, white bread and cereal.. No donuts (i've got donut when i stayed there a few years ago). The only thing i hated is the walking noise from the upper deck rooms (2 level). There'll be creaking noise when other guest walk around the room or dragging their luggages. If you're light sleeper, maybe should get the upper deck one. Overall, the motel is ok to us as most of the time we're out and only back to the room at night. There's a little nice pool but it's too cold to use it right now.. maybe during summer-time when we have chance to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SleepyTime
Reviews.Content: After being rudely treated late in the night by another hotel down the road, we had to find another hotel on the spot. The man at the desk of the Days Inn was extremely nice. He gave us a clean, non-smoking room at a discounted price (probably due to our late arrival). The parking was secure, the location was great, good rates, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BritGirl617
Reviews.Content: I have read a number of the bad reviews on this site regarding this hotel, and in my opinion, they are all unfair. I am well travelled in the USA and this is a good, clean comfortable motel, which I chose because of its proximity to the subway station. You have to laugh at disparaging remarks about it being not near Universal Studios, it is just a couple of subway stops away, yet a motel nearer the studios would cost 2 or 3 times as much. It is on a main road, easy to find by car, near some good restaurants and just a stones throw from the Walk of Fame, if you take the subway, it is just 30 feet or so from the front door, and a few stops and you are at Kodak Theatre and the hubbub of Hollywood. Great hotel if you are looking for cheap, clean and comfortable, great friendly staff and breakfast thrown in. Ralph's is across the street if you fancy a little more than cereal for your breakfast. I would recommend it to anyone travelling through Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, good location”
Reviews.Author: profshanku
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights. Staff was friendly and helpful. We came back late at night and neighborhood seemed safe. Rooms were reasonably clean. Also it is one minute walk from the Hollywood/western metro station which can take you anywhere. Great location for the price. Will stay there again. Unlike other reviews, did not see any bugs or roaches in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff but too many guests”
Reviews.Author: Goloh
Reviews.Content: I needed a "value" motel in Hollywood and didn't want to take my chances without booking in advance, so went online for this chain whose name I have used before. Prior reviews were mixed to negative. Met only two staff persons, first at check-in (he let me check in much earlier than the "official" time, for which I was grateful) then at check-out, also a nice guy who said "we've never heard of such complaints as yours before." I doubt that: because of the location in the sleazier side of Hollywood, and because of the lower price and the national chain affiliation, the place was completely full both nights--and the other customers were taking full advantage. Banging doors, thumps, and so on, all night long. Sirens. Ambulances. Just noise everywhere. The room had a frig, which was good, but not much TV service--abbreviated cable, but terrible TV reception. The airconditioner worked but only as "full on" or off, so it had to be turned off as it was really freezing. Opening the window in that ground floor room would have been madness. It is not so much anything the staff did wrong that made the experience less than great. They got me in early, and the booking terms were exactly as described online. But for peace and quiet--"get off the boulevard."

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING SERVICE, TRENDY HOTEL, SAFE, Best Economy hotel in Hollywood!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently my friend and I planned a trip from Georgia, and we found the service and our stay at this hotel bigger and beyond what we expected. They have a very excellent young, friendly, and helpful staff. They are located in the middle of everything you want to see, and the metro is right next door so we didnt have to rent a car. Their dinner Angel's restaurant has wonderful breakfast. Rooms were amazing! I would recommend anyone traveling to say here .... you definetly get way more service for the price you pay!!! Natalie and Sarah Atlanta, Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first 5 nights of our 5 weeks holiday travelling around the west coast of the states. Definatly the worst hotel of the trip! Room was small, dirty, nothing worked. If your on a tight budget and on a travelling holdiay and dont mind NOT having any comforts then great but other that that dont bother. NOT STAYING HERE EVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Andrewiltn
Reviews.Content: This motel is simply horrendous. We had booked three nights hoping to base here for visiting Universal Studios and Hollywood. On our visit to the USA we had stayed in a good number of other hotels so on arrival we were not surprised by the location right by the very busy and noisy Hollywood Boulevard. But on entering our room we were simply astonished and appalled. Apart from a bed, TV, chair and bathroom there were no other 'facilities'. There was nowhere to hang clothes and little room to have suitcases open. Plug sockets looked unsafe as some were hanging out of the wall. Then my wife inspected the bed. There were 'soiled' tissues under the bottom sheet. The bed and room smelt of smoke (non-smoking room). The room was dirty.The bathroom had not been properly cleaned and the toilet.......(don't ask !) When leaving the room to speak to reception I was stopped by a woman who was begging - on the hotel property ! We just couldn't stay a moment longer. The receptionist seemed unfazed by our complaint and refunded the 2nd and 3rd nights payment but was unable to refund for the first night. Although not happy with this - we had only been in the room for 10 minutes - we had to accept as we just wanted to get away. This hotel is just awful. There appear to be no housekeeping standards, the hotel description on the Days Inn web site is far from satifactory. Anybody thinking of staying here other than as a hostel equivalent should give it a very wide berth.

HotelInfo.Name: The Dixie Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: 5410 Hollywood Boulevard, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027 (Formerly Days Inn Hollywood)
